description: Harish Salve, former Solicitor General of India, is counted among one of the most expensive lawyers in India. As per an estimate by LegallyIndia.com in 2015, Salve charges anything between 6 and 15 lakh per appearance. His fee can reportedly go up to Rs 30 lakh a day also.
title: Harish Salve, the man who anticipated India's victory at ICJ - Times of India

author: Reuters
description: India is one of the world's fastest growing mobile phone markets.
title: Apple Is Now Assembling a Low-Cost iPhone in Southern India

author: Nagraj Gollapudi
description: Harbhajan Singh has asked for India's domestic cricketers to be given contracts in order to ensure their financial security
title: Harbhajan asks for contracts for India's domestic players

description: General Motors will stop selling cars in India from the end of this year. Chevrolet is GM's only brand in India. The move is part of restructuring efforts. However, the auto major will convert its existing factory in Talegaon into an 'export-only' role and maintain its tech centre in Bengaluru.
title: General Motors to stop selling cars in India, but to keep manufacturing centre - Times of India

description: India will seek annulment of the secret Pakistani military court’s death sentence for Kulbhushan Jadhav. This was stated by Harish Salve, India’s counsel at the International Court of Justice (ICJ), who indicated that seeking consular access to Jadhav may not be the priority now.
title: India will seek annulment of Pak military court’s death sentence to Kulbhushan Jadhav - Times of India

author: ESPNcricinfo staff
description: Half-centuries from Mithali Raj and Punam Raut helped India women make light work of a 157 chase in the final against South Africa
title: Goswami, Raj star in India's title win

author: Special Correspondent
description: India falls 11 places, holds 154th position in Global Burden of Disease rankings
title: Chance of newborn survival: Somalia better off than India

author: Rajat Pandit
description: India and Singapore on Thursday kicked off a major naval exercise “SIMBEX” in the contentious South China Sea, where China is locked in bitter territorial disputes with most of its neighbours.
title: India, Singapore kick off major naval exercise in South China Sea - Times of India

description: NEW DELHI: One of the biggest auto makers in the world, General Motors began its India journey in 1996 - much before the likes of Renault and Nissan, and around the same time as Hyundai.
title: General Motors to wrap India sales: Chevrolet cars that will say farewell - Times of India

description: The US-based technology major Apple has started selling iPhones at select stores in the country that were assembled in India as part of its trial run.
title: Apple selling 'Made-in-India' iPhones at select stores: Report | Gadgets Now
